peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do you get coins appraised without getting ripped off?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: You can pay a professional appraiser to do it (only worth it if you already know the collection is worth a significant pile of money). You can ask your local coin shop for help. Most likely they will give you a very low-ball estimate. Or you can do it the hard (and fun) way. Study your coin collection.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How to get an honest appraisal of a coin collection of all US coins - Quora

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do I know if a coin I have is valuable?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: A coin is ultimately worth what the collector is willing to pay for it, but there are factors you should consider before committing to a price. This can include the condition of the coin, its design, mintage figure and what it's made of.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Guide to Getting a Fair Price for a Coin | The Royal Mint

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do you know if a coin appraiser is legit?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Research Appraisers: Look for reputable coin appraisers or numismatists. You can find them through: - Professional organizations like the American Numismatic Association (ANA). - Local coin shops or dealers with good reviews. - Online directories of certified appraisers.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How to have a coin collection appraised - Quora
